clinical_study.brief_title: Atlas of Intracranial Recordings on Cortical Responses After Functional tACS
clinical_study.official_title: An Atlas of Cerebral Responses to the Stimuli of the tACS Recorded by SEEG

brief_summary.textblock: By analyzing the SEEG recordings, we explore the range of cortical functional responses to strings of 77.5Hz stimulations delivered by tACS,

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 250 ms immediately after the stimulation.
primary_outcome.description: The change of the power in a band of 0-200 HZ according to the intracranial EEG recording.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 50 minutes during the stimulation and 50 minutes of the interictal baseline before the intervention during the same hour of the day
secondary_outcome.description: To count the numbers of epileptic discharges within the same duration before and when tACS intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: 24 hours before the tACS intervention; Observation: Immediately after the end of the tACS intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: ERP related to cognitive tasks before and immediately after the tACS intervention

arm_group.description: The patient would receive strings of tACS stimulations in 77.5 HZ, each string would last for 1 second, followed by an interval of 5 seconds. A total of 600 strings would be sent out to the patients.

intervention.description: tACS would be performed to epilepsy patients who have already received implantation of the SEEG electrodes

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Neurosurgery, Capital Medical University
